title: 104_hr2984
content: Extension and modification of research credit. Extension of the research credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend deadlines to December 31, 1997, and January 1, 1998. The base amount for start-up companies is also modified to determine the fixed-base percentage for qualifying taxpayers. The research credit under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is extended with modified deadlines and base amount calculations for start-up companies. Taxpayers can elect an alternative incremental credit option. The taxpayer can elect an alternative incremental credit option, where the credit is determined based on different percentages of qualified research expenses exceeding certain averages. The taxpayer may elect an alternative incremental credit option for the first taxable year after June 30, 1995, which will apply to that year and subsequent years unless revoked. The amendment increases the credit for contract research expenses with respect to certain research consortia by substituting '80 percent' for '65 percent'. The taxpayer can elect an alternative incremental credit option for the first taxable year after June 30, 1995, which will apply to that year and subsequent years unless revoked. The amendment increases the credit for contract research expenses with respect to certain research consortia by substituting '80 percent' for '65 percent'. The taxpayer can incur expenses to a qualified research consortium for qualified research. A qualified research consortium is an organization described in subsection (e)(6)(B) if at least 15 unrelated taxpayers paid amounts for qualified research during the calendar year in which the taxpayer's taxable year begins. No 3 persons can pay more than 50 percent of the total amounts paid during that calendar year. The amendment increases the credit for contract research expenses with respect to certain research consortia by substituting '80 percent' for '65 percent'. The taxpayer can elect an alternative incremental credit option for the first taxable year after June 30, 1995. No person can contribute more than 20 percent of the total amounts paid for qualified research during the calendar year. Related taxpayers are treated as a single employer. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years ending after June 30, 1995. The amendments made by subsections (c) and (d) will apply to taxable years beginning after June 30, 1995.
